etymologies: mid 19th century: from French, literally ‘small plank’, diminutive of planche

definitions: a small board supported on casters, typically heart-shaped and fitted with a vertical pencil, used for automatic writing and in seances

examples.text: the planchette jerked and skittered to the upper left-hand corner of the paper

shortDefinitions: small board supported on castors, used for automatic writing and in seances
